title: Švarc–Milnor lemma
summary: In the mathematical subject of geometric group theory, the Švarc–Milnor lemma   (sometimes also called Milnor–Švarc lemma, with both variants also sometimes spelling Švarc as  Schwarz)  is a statement which says that a group G {\displaystyle G} , equipped with a "nice" discrete isometric action on a metric space X {\displaystyle X} , is  quasi-isometric to X {\displaystyle X} .
